term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - resolving time, in nuclear analytical chemistry
term.title: resolving time

item.text: The smallest time interval which must elapse between the occurrence of two consecutive ionizing events or signal pulses, in order that the measuring device be capable of fulfilling its function of each of them separately.

sources.item: PAC, 1982, 54, 1533. 'Glossary of terms used in nuclear analytical chemistry (Provisional)' on page 1551 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac198254081533)
